review_title: Another government agency that could be so much better run
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ballymena, Northern Ireland

job_title: Student IT Worker in Antrim, Northern Ireland

Really good holidays
Managers are definitely very flexible
cons: There wasn't actually any cons, would work here again

job_title: Administrative in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: opportunities to progress and move up bands. great pension available.
cons: do not have any cons to notte

job_title: Senior Manager in Ballymena, Northern Ireland

cons: High expectations - very high workload and high pressure. Lots of long term sickness.

job_title: Technical Data Specialist in Ballymoney, Northern Ireland
pros: Great place to work with friendly and helpful colleagues.
cons: Pay could be a bit better for the work

job_title: Industrial Placement Student in Ballymoney, Northern Ireland

Great staff
Good management
Massive amount of experience
cons: Some teams are understaffed and the other employees have to pick up the workload

job_title: ICT Officer in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Flexible, good working environment, interesting
cons: Lower pay compared to other positions in private sector

job_title: Ward Clerk in Antrim, Northern Ireland
pros: Good job satisfaction and team spirit

job_title: Info Officer in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Work from home, great collegues, friendly
cons: Upper management lack of contact

review_title: Good T&C, management poor in many areas
job_title: Registered Nurse in Antrim, Northern Ireland
pros: Health service terms and conditions
cons: You will not get promoted above a certain level unless you belong to the in-group. Those in top nursing jobs within the organisation are all connected or have been c connected in some way etc

job_title: Healthcare Assistant in Antrim, Northern Ireland
pros: Very satisfied in my role
cons: Promotion seldom comes up in my department

job_title: Speech and Language Therapist in Antrim, Northern Ireland
pros: Supportive friendly team, good peer support
cons: Reduced staffing, long community waiting lists

job_title: Healthcare Assistant in Frimley, England
pros: Rewarding role at times, benefits are v.good
cons:
Flexibility impossible
Management is more important than patient care
Don't look out for the staffs health and wellbeing
Very poor salary for the front facing staff

job_title: Doctor Fy2 in London, England
pros: rewarding work, interesting, can do anywhere in the country, almost guaranteed career progression, clever people, mostly people that genuinely want to do good, variety of future options, good pension,
cons: constantly being talked down in the media, poor wage given debt/study undertaken, regular weekend/night/evening work, difficult to make change at a junior level, chronic understaffing problem

review_title: Low wages, limited opportunities for progression
job_title: Anonymous in Leeds, England
pros: Nice ambience because people I worked with were lovely, big community
cons: Wages very poor, long working hours and random days off during the week, paid for weekends as per normal day, poor work life balance, limited opportunities for progression for those who are ambitious unless you are higher up in hierarchy already

job_title: Senior Secretary in Telford, England
pros: Experienced the rewards of dealing with all walks of life be it face to face or via the telephone and was a very rewarding, challenging and exciting role.
cons: Very occasionally having to deal with sometimes very desperate situations which could be traumatic but dealing in mental health this is to be expected.

job_title: Implementation Project Manager in Nottingham, England
pros: Job security, challenging environment, a we're in this together attitude, access to training, the feeling that you are actually helping people with the work you do, good pension scheme,
cons: salary is often lower than the market average, there are lots of people in the service who are 'waiting for their pension' and therefore not striving for improvement, it takes a long time to get anything done due to the red tape involved

review_title: Ok and safe but won't win employer of the year!
job_title: in London, England
pros: Good benefits-pension, maternity, sick leave
cons: Lots of unmotivated staff, lots of bureaucracy. HR don't seem to exist or be accessible. Payroll can vary in each organisation but in the hospitals can be so disorganised  you don't get paid for first 1-2 months (it's reimbursed eventually). No money to vest in people.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: flexible work environment, each day's work was a good variety. great colleagues and good facilities, good prospects for climbing up the career ladder
cons: there were not many cons, perhaps the volume of work was inconsistent, some days there was minimal and other days breaks had to be skipped to meet deadlines

review_title: Is it really a caring profession
job_title: Clinical Support Worker in Airdrie, Scotland
pros: Working with patients and their families who appreciate your hard work
cons: No back up from management. Friends of management passing stories on to make them look good. If your face doesn't fit look out!!!!

review_title: Good organisation with lots of opportunites.
job_title: Team Leader/Data Officer in London, England
pros: Being a part of an organisation who looks after people 365 days a year, 7 days a week night and day.
cons: Flexibility may be challenging, dependent on the department your are working in.

job_title: Medical Record Clerk in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: I work part time out of hours. You get time and 44% 8pm-7am and all day on Saturdays. On a Sunday (midnight to midnight) you get time and 88%
cons: Not enough training for changes e.g. Going paperlite

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros:
Serves a wide geographical area. Meet patients/colleagues from a vast area within NI.
Excellent ICU facilities/skilled staff cohort
cons:
Top down leadership approach.
Some senior management lack compassion & empathy- Trust/NHS core values on paper only.

review_title: Fantastic, great company with even better values
job_title: Marketing in Belfast, Northern Ireland

cons: Located a couple of miles outside Belfast - but not a major issue

review_title: I love the NHS in Stoke
